title: I05-4010

sentences.text: In this paper we present our recent work on harvesting English-Chinese bitexts of the laws of Hong Kong from the Web and aligning them to the subparagraph level via utilizing the numbering system in the legal text hierarchy .
Basic methodology and practical techniques are reported in detail .
The resultant bilingual corpus , 10.4 M English words and 18.3 M Chinese characters , is an authoritative and comprehensive text collection covering the specific and special domain of HK laws .
It is particularly valuable to empirical MT research .
This piece of work has also laid a foundation for exploring and harvesting English-Chinese bitexts in a larger volume from the Web .

Entity-this_paper.label: this paper
Entity-this_paper.description: This paper presents research on the methodology and techniques for harvesting and aligning English-Chinese bitexts of Hong Kong's laws from the Web, resulting in a bilingual corpus valuable for empirical machine translation research.

Entity-this_piece_of_work.label: This piece of work
Entity-this_piece_of_work.description: This piece of work refers to the research conducted on harvesting and aligning English-Chinese bitexts of Hong Kong laws from the Web, resulting in a bilingual corpus that supports further exploration in this area.

Entity-the_resultant_bilingual_corpus.label: The resultant bilingual corpus
Entity-the_resultant_bilingual_corpus.description: The resultant bilingual corpus refers to a comprehensive collection of English and Chinese legal texts, specifically 10.4 million English words and 18.3 million Chinese characters, aligned at the subparagraph level, which serves as a valuable resource for empirical machine translation research in the context of Hong Kong laws.

Entity-18.3_m_chinese_character.label: 18.3 M Chinese characters
Entity-18.3_m_chinese_character.description: The mention '18.3 M Chinese characters' refers to the total count of Chinese characters in a bilingual corpus that includes legal texts from Hong Kong, which is part of a larger effort to harvest and align English-Chinese bitexts.

Entity-an_authoritative_and_comprehensiv.label: an authoritative and comprehensive text collection
aliases: an authoritative and comprehensive text collection
Entity-an_authoritative_and_comprehensiv.description: An authoritative and comprehensive text collection refers to a bilingual corpus of English and Chinese laws of Hong Kong, consisting of 10.4 million English words and 18.3 million Chinese characters, specifically designed for empirical machine translation research.

mentions.local_name: an authoritative and comprehensive text collection

Entity-web.label: Web
Entity-web.description: The 'Web' refers to the internet platform used for harvesting English-Chinese bitexts of Hong Kong laws.

Entity-our_recent_work.label: our recent work
Entity-our_recent_work.description: The term 'our recent work' refers to the research focused on harvesting and aligning English-Chinese bitexts of Hong Kong's laws from the Web, resulting in a bilingual corpus that supports empirical machine translation research.

Entity-exploring_and_harvesting_english-.label: exploring and harvesting English-Chinese bitexts
Entity-exploring_and_harvesting_english-.description: The phrase 'exploring and harvesting English-Chinese bitexts' refers to the process of collecting and analyzing bilingual text data, specifically English and Chinese legal documents from the Web, to create a comprehensive corpus for empirical machine translation research.

Entity-10.4_m_english_word.label: 10.4 M English words
Entity-10.4_m_english_word.description: 10.4 M English words refers to the total word count of an authoritative bilingual corpus created from English-Chinese bitexts of the laws of Hong Kong.

Entity-basic_methodology_and_practical_t.label: Basic methodology and practical techniques
Entity-basic_methodology_and_practical_t.description: The phrase 'Basic methodology and practical techniques' refers to the systematic approaches and specific methods employed in the research for harvesting and aligning English-Chinese bitexts of Hong Kong laws from the Web.

Entity-basic_methodology.label: Basic methodology
Entity-basic_methodology.description: Basic methodology refers to the foundational approaches and practical techniques employed in the research for harvesting and aligning English-Chinese bitexts of Hong Kong laws from the Web.

Entity-technique.label: techniques
Entity-technique.description: The term 'techniques' refers to the practical methods employed in the research for harvesting and aligning English-Chinese bitexts of Hong Kong laws.

Entity-the_law_of_hong_kong.label: the laws of Hong Kong
Entity-the_law_of_hong_kong.description: The laws of Hong Kong refer to the legal statutes, regulations, and legal texts that govern the jurisdiction of Hong Kong, which are being harvested and aligned for bilingual English-Chinese corpus development.

Entity-the_web.label: the Web
Entity-the_web.description: the Web refers to the vast network of interconnected digital resources and information accessible via the internet, from which English-Chinese bitexts of the laws of Hong Kong were harvested for research purposes.

Entity-subparagraph_level.label: subparagraph level
Entity-subparagraph_level.description: The 'subparagraph level' refers to a specific tier within the legal text hierarchy that allows for detailed alignment and organization of legal documents, particularly in the context of English-Chinese bilingual bitexts of Hong Kong laws.

Entity-a_larger_volume_from_the_web.label: a larger volume from the Web
aliases: a larger volume from the Web
Entity-a_larger_volume_from_the_web.description: A larger volume from the Web refers to the extensive collection of English-Chinese bitexts that can be harvested from online sources, aimed at enhancing the bilingual corpus for empirical machine translation research.

mentions.local_name: a larger volume from the Web

Entity-english-chinese_bitexts.label: English-Chinese bitexts
Entity-english-chinese_bitexts.description: English-Chinese bitexts are bilingual texts that consist of parallel translations of content in English and Chinese, often used for language learning, translation studies, and linguistic research.

Entity-larger_volume.label: larger volume
Entity-larger_volume.description: The term 'larger volume' refers to an increased quantity of English-Chinese bitexts that can be harvested from the Web, building upon the foundational work presented in the paper.

Entity-law_of_hong_kong.label: laws of Hong Kong
Entity-law_of_hong_kong.description: The laws of Hong Kong refer to the body of legislation, regulations, and legal principles that govern the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, encompassing both local statutes and applicable international laws.

Entity-legal_text_hierarchy.label: legal text hierarchy
Entity-legal_text_hierarchy.description: The legal text hierarchy refers to the structured organization and numbering system used in legal documents, which facilitates the alignment and retrieval of specific legal provisions, such as subparagraphs, in the context of bilingual legal text processing.

Entity-the_numbering_system_in_the_legal.label: the numbering system in the legal text hierarchy
aliases: the numbering system in the legal text hierarchy
Entity-the_numbering_system_in_the_legal.description: The numbering system in the legal text hierarchy refers to the structured method used to organize and reference legal documents and their components, such as laws and regulations, in a systematic way that facilitates the alignment and retrieval of bilingual legal texts.

mentions.local_name: the numbering system in the legal text hierarchy

Entity-hk_law.label: HK laws
Entity-hk_law.description: HK laws refer to the legal statutes, regulations, and legal principles that govern the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region.

Entity-the_specific_and_special_domain_o.label: the specific and special domain of HK laws
aliases: the specific and special domain of HK laws
Entity-the_specific_and_special_domain_o.description: The specific and special domain of HK laws refers to the unique legal framework and regulations governing Hong Kong, which are distinct from those of mainland China, and encompass a wide range of legal texts and statutes that are relevant to the region.

mentions.local_name: the specific and special domain of HK laws

Entity-bilingual_corpus.label: bilingual corpus
Entity-bilingual_corpus.description: A bilingual corpus is a linguistic resource that consists of a collection of texts in two languages, used for various purposes such as translation, language learning, and linguistic research.

Entity-chinese_character.label: Chinese characters
Entity-chinese_character.description: Chinese characters are logograms used in the writing system of the Chinese language, representing words or morphemes.

Entity-hong_kong.label: Hong Kong
Entity-hong_kong.description: Hong Kong is a Special Administrative Region of China located on the southern coast of the country, known for its vibrant economy, rich cultural heritage, and significant global financial center.

Entity-numbering_system.label: numbering system
Entity-numbering_system.description: A numbering system is an organizational framework used to assign numerical identifiers to elements within a structured text, such as legal documents, to facilitate reference and navigation.

Entity-empirical_mt_research.label: empirical MT research
Entity-empirical_mt_research.description: Empirical MT research refers to the systematic investigation and analysis of machine translation methods and systems through the collection and evaluation of data to assess their effectiveness and performance.

Entity-mt.label: MT
Entity-mt.description: MT refers to 'Machine Translation', which is a field of study focused on the automated translation of text from one language to another, and is particularly relevant in the context of the empirical research presented in the paper.

Entity-english_word.label: English words
Entity-english_word.description: English words are the individual units of language that are part of the English language, used for communication and expression.

Entity-methodology.label: methodology
Entity-methodology.description: Methodology refers to a systematic framework or set of principles that guide the selection and application of research methods and approaches in a study.

summary: In this paper we present our recent work on harvesting English-Chinese bitexts of the laws of Hong Kong from the Web and aligning them to the subparagraph level via utilizing the numbering system in the legal text hierarchy . Basic methodology and practical techniques are reported in detail . The resultant bilingual corpus , 10.4 M English words and 18.3 M Chinese characters , is an authoritative and comprehensive text collection covering the specific and special domain of HK laws . It is particularly valuable to empirical MT research . This piece of work has also laid a foundation for exploring and harvesting English-Chinese bitexts in a larger volume from the Web .

Predicate-presents.label: presents
Predicate-presents.description: The predicate 'presents' indicates that the subject is introducing, showcasing, or displaying the object to an audience. It implies a formal or structured communication of information, findings, or ideas, where the subject serves as the medium through which the object is conveyed.

Predicate-harvests.label: harvests
Predicate-harvests.description: The predicate 'harvests' indicates an action where the subject actively gathers, collects, or extracts a specific type of resource or information represented by the object. In this context, it implies that the subject is engaged in the process of obtaining or compiling the object, which can be data, materials, or any other form of content, suggesting a productive and purposeful effort.

Predicate-of.label: of
Predicate-of.description: The predicate 'of' is used to indicate a relationship of belonging, association, or origin between the subject and the object. It connects the subject to the object by expressing that the subject is related to, derived from, or characterized by the object, often implying a part-whole relationship or a specific context in which the subject exists.

Predicate-from.label: from
Predicate-from.description: The predicate 'from' indicates a source or origin relationship between the subject and the object, suggesting that the subject is derived, obtained, or influenced by the object. It establishes a directional connection where the subject is linked to the object as its point of reference or starting point.

Predicate-aligns.label: aligns
Predicate-aligns.description: The predicate 'aligns' indicates a relationship where the subject is in agreement, harmony, or correspondence with the object. It suggests that the subject is structured or organized in a way that is consistent with the principles, criteria, or framework represented by the object. This connection implies a level of coherence or compatibility between the two entities.

Predicate-via_utilizing.label: via utilizing
Predicate-via_utilizing.description: The predicate 'via utilizing' indicates a method or means by which the subject engages with or applies the object. It suggests that the subject is actively employing the object as a tool or resource to achieve a specific purpose or outcome. In this context, it emphasizes the process of using the object to facilitate or enhance the subject's function or operation.

Predicate-are_reported_in_detail.label: are reported in detail
Predicate-are_reported_in_detail.description: The predicate 'are reported in detail' indicates that the subject provides a comprehensive and thorough account or description of the object. It suggests that the information conveyed about the object is extensive, covering various aspects and nuances, thereby enhancing the understanding of the subject matter.

Predicate-is.label: is
Predicate-is.description: The predicate 'is' serves as a linking verb that establishes an identity or equivalence between the subject and the object. It indicates that the subject can be defined or characterized by the object, suggesting that they are fundamentally the same in some respect or that the object provides a specific classification or description of the subject.

Predicate-covers.label: covers
Predicate-covers.description: The predicate 'covers' indicates that the subject encompasses, includes, or addresses the content or aspects represented by the object. It signifies a relationship where the subject provides information, support, or relevance to the object, suggesting that the subject has a scope or range that extends to the object.

Predicate-contains.label: contains
Predicate-contains.description: The predicate 'contains' indicates that the subject has within it or includes the object as a part or component. It establishes a relationship where the subject is a whole that encompasses the object, which represents a specific quantity, item, or set of items that are present within the subject.

Predicate-laid_a_foundation_for.label: laid a foundation for
Predicate-laid_a_foundation_for.description: The predicate 'laid a foundation for' indicates that the subject has established a basis or groundwork that enables or supports the development, exploration, or implementation of the object. It suggests that the subject's contributions or actions are essential for the future progress or understanding of the object, thereby creating a link between the initial effort and subsequent activities or studies related to the object.

Predicate-in_a.label: in a
Predicate-in_a.description: The predicate 'in a' serves to indicate the context or manner in which the action or state described by the subject occurs, specifically relating it to the object. It suggests that the subject is being carried out within the framework or scope defined by the object, often implying a degree of scale, extent, or specific condition that characterizes the relationship between the two.

Predicate-results_in.label: results in
Predicate-results_in.description: The predicate 'results in' indicates a causal or consequential relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject's actions, processes, or conditions lead to the emergence or creation of the object. It implies that the subject is a contributing factor that directly influences the outcome represented by the object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or subset that falls under the more general category represented by the object. This relationship implies that the object encompasses a wider scope or range of concepts, of which the subject is a part, thereby facilitating a classification or categorization of knowledge.
